benchmark_details.name: Chart M3 (Multimodal Chart Editing with Multi-level Complexity and Multi-perspective Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: Chart M3 is a new benchmark for multimodal chart editing, where user intent is expressed through a combination of natural language and visual indicators. It contains 1,000 samples spanning four levels of editing difficulty, each including triplets in the form of (chart, code, multimodal instructions).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate multimodal large language models’ capabilities through chart editing tasks with natural language instructions and visual indicators.

data.source: Curated datasets for visual indicator-guided and text-guided chart editing tasks.
data.annotation: Automatically generated bounding box annotations and quality control via GPT-4 validation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics assess the visual appearance and code correctness after chart modifications.
methodology.interpretation: High ΔSSIM indicates visual fidelity, while the directive compliance ratio measures correct modifications.
methodology.validation: Evaluated across multiple MLLMs, testing the models' visual comprehension and code generation.
